text: what's the truth of your ambition
are you ambitious first and foremost for
yourself
first and foremost for your own
aggrandizement first and foremost for
what you get out of all of this
or are you ambitious first and foremost
for a cause for the company for the work
for something bigger than yourself
and what's interesting when we look in
from the outside i don't i can't measure
this
but my sense from all of my research is
that people have an amazing ability
given enough time they may not know it
right up front
to be able to intuit to be able to tell
what the real truth of someone's
ambition
is
is it about them or is it about the
cause is it about them or is it about
the company is it about them
or about something bigger than them
and how do people tell
they watch their actual decisions their
actual actions
people are very attuned to watching
little cues little actions little steps
and when they see any inconsistency
it'll magnify 100 or a hundred thousand
times
and you can do a
thousand things that are consistent with
what you say you're about and do one
thing that's inconsistent and it wipes
out the thousand
the trust is built by
an almost unblemished record of
consistency with what you say you're
about
founded on the idea
that it's not about you
i believe that that's where the trust
really begins when we look in the social
sectors the great social secular leaders
like francis hesselbein who got all of
these people in the girl scouts to go
behind what she was trying to do they
all knew it wasn't about francis
it was about the girl scouts it was
about the girls
and their development
and that is why she had that trust
